task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm by perceiving, approaching, grasping, and lifting.

task_long_description.overview: This episode consists of a tabletop scene with a stationary red cylindrical object and a blue object on a black surface. A robot arm is tasked to pick up the red object from the table. The process involves perceiving the object's location, planning and approaching from above, executing a top-style grasp, and confirming the object is in the gripper. The gripper is initially open for the approach. Precise contact and alignment, followed by a stable closure, are key constraints.
preconditions: Red object is present and visible on the table.
Robot arm is initialized and has an empty gripper.
stepwise_plan: Verify the red object is visible; detect if necessary.
Move above the red object with a set offset.
Compute a top grasp pose for the red object.
Approach and align with precise tolerance.
Lower until gentle contact with the tabled object.
Close gripper to grasp the red object.
Check that the object is held in the gripper.
success_criteria: Red object is no longer on the table.
Object is secured in the gripper after grasping.
failure_and_recovery: Failed grasp: retry after adjusting pose.
Contact not established: lower again with same or less force.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after object is confirmed in gripper, or abort if unreachable or gripper cannot close.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red object is visible for perception.
Invokes perception action to detect red object.
Opens the gripper to width 0.06 for approach.
Moves the gripper above the red object by 0.05m.
Computes a top grasp pose for the red object.
Approaches and aligns the gripper to the red object.
Lowers the gripper until contact is detected with the object.
Closes the gripper with minimum allowed force (10).
Checks if the red object is being securely held after grasping.

failure_modes: Red object not detected or occluded
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and re-lower if no contact
Open gripper and try again if grasp incomplete
assumptions: Instruction specifies 'pick up the red object from the table': Frames confirm a red object (cylinder) is present and picked up; table is black surface.
Frames do not show any object placement or transfer, so only the pick portion is modeled.
No evidence of retries required in this specific trial; robust single-attempt BT produced.
The precise dimensions/shape from frames (cylinder) motivates 'top' grasp strategy.
No indication of grasp failures in frames; assumes success on first attempt.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is removed from its initial location.
Gripper securely holds object at final state.
